004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.PowerDistributionJNI;
010import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
013
014/**
015 * Class for getting voltage, current, temperature, power and energy from the Power Distribution
016 * Panel over CAN.
017 */
018public class PowerDistribution implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
019  private final int m_handle;
020  private final int m_module;
021
022  public static final int kDefaultModule = PowerDistributionJNI.DEFAULT_MODULE;
023
024  public enum ModuleType {
025    kAutomatic(PowerDistributionJNI.AUTOMATIC_TYPE),
026    kCTRE(PowerDistributionJNI.CTRE_TYPE),
027    kRev(PowerDistributionJNI.REV_TYPE);
028
029    public final int value;
030
031    ModuleType(int value) {
032      this.value = value;
033    }
034  }
035
036  /**
037   * Constructs a PowerDistribution.
038   *
039   * @param module The CAN ID of the PDP.
040   * @param moduleType Module type (automatic, CTRE, or REV).
041   */
042  public PowerDistribution(int module, ModuleType moduleType) {
043    m_handle = PowerDistributionJNI.initialize(module, moduleType.value);
044    m_module = PowerDistributionJNI.getModuleNumber(m_handle);
045
046    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_PDP, m_module + 1);
047    SendableRegistry.addLW(this, "PowerDistribution", m_module);
048  }
049
050  /**
051   * Constructs a PowerDistribution.
052   *
053   * <p>Uses the default CAN ID.
054   */
055  public PowerDistribution() {
056    this(kDefaultModule, ModuleType.kAutomatic);
057  }
058
059  @Override
060  public void close() {
061    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Gets the number of channel for this power distribution.
066   *
067   * @return Number of output channels.
068   */
069  public int getNumChannels() {
070    return PowerDistributionJNI.getNumChannels(m_handle);
071  }
072
073  /**
074   * Query the input voltage of the PDP.
075   *
076   * @return The voltage of the PDP in volts
077   */
078  public double getVoltage() {
079    return PowerDistributionJNI.getVoltage(m_handle);
080  }
081
082  /**
083   * Query the temperature of the PDP.
084   *
085   * @return The temperature of the PDP in degrees Celsius
086   */
087  public double getTemperature() {
088    return PowerDistributionJNI.getTemperature(m_handle);
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Query the current of a single channel of the PDP.
093   *
094   * @param channel The PDP channel to query.
095   * @return The current of one of the PDP channels (channels 0-15) in Amperes
096   */
097  public double getCurrent(int channel) {
098    double current = PowerDistributionJNI.getChannelCurrent(m_handle, channel);
099
100    return current;
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Query the current of all monitored PDP channels (0-15).
105   *
106   * @return The current of all the channels in Amperes
107   */
108  public double getTotalCurrent() {
109    return PowerDistributionJNI.getTotalCurrent(m_handle);
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Query the total power drawn from the monitored PDP channels.
114   *
115   * @return the total power in Watts
116   */
117  public double getTotalPower() {
118    return PowerDistributionJNI.getTotalPower(m_handle);
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Query the total energy drawn from the monitored PDP channels.
123   *
124   * @return the total energy in Joules
125   */
126  public double getTotalEnergy() {
127    return PowerDistributionJNI.getTotalEnergy(m_handle);
128  }
129
130  /** Reset the total energy to 0. */
131  public void resetTotalEnergy() {
132    PowerDistributionJNI.resetTotalEnergy(m_handle);
133  }
134
135  /** Clear all PDP sticky faults. */
136  public void clearStickyFaults() {
137    PowerDistributionJNI.clearStickyFaults(m_handle);
138  }
139
140  /**
141   * Gets module number (CAN ID).
142   *
143   * @return The module number (CAN ID).
144   */
145  public int getModule() {
146    return m_module;
147  }
148
149  public boolean getSwitchableChannel() {
150    return PowerDistributionJNI.getSwitchableChannel(m_handle);
151  }
152
153  public void setSwitchableChannel(boolean enabled) {
154    PowerDistributionJNI.setSwitchableChannel(m_handle, enabled);
155  }
156
157  @Override
158  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
159    builder.setSmartDashboardType("PowerDistribution");
160    int numChannels = getNumChannels();
161    for (int i = 0; i < numChannels; ++i) {
162      final int chan = i;
163      builder.addDoubleProperty(
164          "Chan" + i, () -> PowerDistributionJNI.getChannelCurrentNoError(m_handle, chan), null);
165    }
166    builder.addDoubleProperty(
167        "Voltage", () -> PowerDistributionJNI.getVoltageNoError(m_handle), null);
168    builder.addDoubleProperty(
169        "TotalCurrent", () -> PowerDistributionJNI.getTotalCurrent(m_handle), null);
170    builder.addBooleanProperty(
171        "SwitchableChannel",
172        () -> PowerDistributionJNI.getSwitchableChannelNoError(m_handle),
173        value -> PowerDistributionJNI.setSwitchableChannel(m_handle, value));
174  }
175}
